column4: trying to get a radeon x1950 in operation in 10.04 but all it does is stay super slow any ideas
I have some ideas.  Look at the output of sudo lspci -k
It will list the driver in use and the kernel modules (drivers not in use) but are availabe.
ok give me min goota boot it again
Do you not understand the output of sudo lspci -k ??
Yeah, VGA Compatible controller, blah blah blah, Kernel Driver in use???  Kernel modules??
What driver is in use?  What modules are listed?
Please start your sentences with my name like I'm doing for you :)
That's ok, are there any kernel modules (which are actually drivers not in use) listed that aren't also listed in drivers ??
is secondary considered not in use
Secondary is a secondary monitor.  It refers to the different outputs you have on the back of the card.
well i only see the one entry in the vga driver section
Try this compiz check script.  It is often very helpful.  http://forlong.blogage.de/entries/pages/Compiz-Check
